abstract: Pope Francis issues new guidelines providing for removal, rather than simply discipline, of Roman Catholic bishops who are found to have failed to properly handle child sex abuse cases; edict is in response to growing outcry against protection offered to bishops who have covered up child sex abuse by priests.
lead_paragraph: Following up on a 2015 promise, a papal decree called for dismissal if a bishop had, “through negligence, committed or omitted acts that have caused grave harm to others.”

headline.main: Pope Francis Sets Guidelines for Removing Bishops Who Mishandle Sex Abuse Cases
